text: A by-election was held for the New South Wales Legislative Assembly seat of Pittwater on 31 May 1986. It was triggered by the resignation of sitting Liberal MP Max Smith. The by-election was won by Liberal candidate Jim Longley. == Background == Labor did not stand a candidate in the by-election, and as a result, this election was almost won by professional surfer and former world surfing champion Nat Young, who ran on a largely environmental ticket. == Results == Liberal MP Max Smith resigned. ==See also== *Electoral results for the district of Pittwater *List of New South Wales state by- elections == References == Category:1986 elections in Australia Category:New South Wales state by-elections Category:1980s in New South Wales
title: 1986 Pittwater state by-election
